verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> <S%H1665>Gittith,<s%> A Psalm of <S%H623>Asaph.<s%> Sing <S%H7442>aloud<s%> unto <S%H430>God<s%> our <S%H5797>strength:<s%> make a joyful <S%H7321>noise<s%> unto the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob.<s%>
Take <S%H5375><s%> a <S%H2172>psalm,<s%> and <S%H5414>bring<s%> hither the <S%H8596>timbrel,<s%> the <S%H5273>pleasant<s%> <S%H3658>harp<s%> <S%H5973>with<s%> the <S%H5035>psaltery.<s%>
Blow <S%H8628>up<s%> the <S%H7782>trumpet<s%> in the new <S%H2320>moon,<s%> in the time <S%H3677>appointed,<s%> on our solemn <S%H2282>feast<s%> <S%H3117>day.<s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> <S%H1931>this<s%> was a <S%H2706>statute<s%> for <S%H3478>Israel,<s%> and a <S%H4941>law<s%> of the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob.<s%>

This he <S%H7760>ordained<s%> in <S%H3084>Joseph<s%> for a <S%H5715>testimony,<s%> when he went <S%H3318>out<s%> <S%H5921>through<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt:<s%> where I <S%H8085>heard<s%> a <S%H8193>language<s%> that I <S%H3045>understood<s%> <S%H3808>not.<s%>
I <S%H5493>removed<s%> his <S%H7926>shoulder<s%> from the <S%H4480>burden:<s%> <S%H5447><s%> his <S%H3709>hands<s%> were <S%H5674>delivered<s%> from the <S%H4480>pots.<s%> <S%H1731><s%>

Thou <S%H7121>calledst<s%> in <S%H6869>trouble,<s%> and I <S%H2502>delivered<s%> thee; I <S%H6030>answered<s%> thee in the secret <S%H5643>place<s%> of <S%H7482>thunder:<s%> I <S%H974>proved<s%> thee <S%H5921>at<s%> the <S%H4325>waters<s%> of <S%H4809>Meribah.<s%> <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>
Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O my <S%H5971>people,<s%> and I will <S%H5749>testify<s%> unto thee: O <S%H3478>Israel,<s%> <S%H518>if<s%> thou wilt <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto me;
There shall <S%H3808>no<s%> <S%H2114>strange<s%> <S%H410>god<s%> <S%H1961>be<s%> in thee; <S%H3808>neither<s%> shalt thou <S%H7812>worship<s%> any <S%H5236>strange<s%> <S%H410>god.<s%>

I <S%H595><s%> am the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God,<s%> which <S%H5927>brought<s%> thee out of the <S%H4480>land<s%> <S%H776><s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt:<s%> open thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7337>wide,<s%> and I will <S%H4390>fill<s%> it.
But my <S%H5971>people<s%> would <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H8085>hearken<s%> to my <S%H6963>voice;<s%> and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> <S%H14>would<s%> <S%H3808>none<s%> of me.
So I gave them <S%H7971>up<s%> unto their own <S%H3820>hearts'<s%> <S%H8307>lust:<s%> and they <S%H1980>walked<s%> in their own <S%H4156>counsels.<s%>
Oh <S%H3863>that<s%> my <S%H5971>people<s%> had <S%H8085>hearkened<s%> unto me, and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> had <S%H1980>walked<s%> in my <S%H1870>ways!<s%>
I should <S%H4592>soon<s%> have <S%H3665>subdued<s%> their <S%H341>enemies,<s%> and <S%H7725>turned<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> <S%H5921>against<s%> their <S%H6862>adversaries.<s%>
The <S%H8130>haters<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> should have <S%H3584>submitted<s%> themselves unto him: but their <S%H6256>time<s%> should have <S%H1961>endured<s%> <S%H5769>forever.<s%>

He should have <S%H398>fed<s%> them also with the <S%H4480>finest<s%> <S%H2459><s%> of the <S%H2406>wheat:<s%> and with <S%H1706>honey<s%> out of the <S%H4480>rock<s%> <S%H6697><s%> should I have <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> thee.
